Q3: How many ways we can use Sass in our application?
a: We can use Sass in our application as a command-line tool.
b: We can use Sass in our application as a standalone Ruby module.
c: We can use Sass in our application as a plugin for any Rack-enabled framework.

a: SASS is more stable, powerful, and fully compatible with CSS3.
b: SASS is time-saving because it facilitates users to write CSS in less code.

question: Q6: Which of the following directive is used to set the style rule to different media types?
Q7: Which of the following is the main reason behind using SASS?
a: SASS facilitates us to write codes easily and efficiently, and they are easy to maintain
b: SASS is a pre-processing language that provides its syntax.
c: SASS is a superset of CSS that contains all CSS features and is an open-source pre-processor coded in Ruby.

question: Q8:What are the key features of SASS?
a: SASS is a CSS pre-processor with syntax advancements and an extension of CSS3.
b: SASS has two syntaxes. The first syntax is SCSS, and it uses the .scss extension.
c: SASS supports language extensions such as nesting, variables, and mixins.
